answers.answer: HiWelcome to the forum!Extreme thirst and headache are common side effects of Amitriptyline. Hunger is not a side effect as such but the drug causes a constant feeling of nausea and acidity which you may be countering with food.The only other possibility is uncontrolled diabetes. Multiple joint pain, numbness, tingling etc along with excess thirst and hunger should be investigated for diabetes.Apart from fibromyalgia multiple joint pain is seen in hypothyroidism, low Vitamin D levels, Low Vit B12 levels, anemia, Hasimotos thyroiditis, gout, rheumatoid arthritis, osteoarthritis, SLE, electrolyte disturbance particularly those involving calcium and magnesium, parathyroid gland problems, chondrocalcinosis and chronic fatigue syndrome.Hence investigations to rule these causes should be carried out.There are many pain medications available. Non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, Cox 2 inhibitor, diclofenac etc are some of the drugs that help relieve pain. On net it is difficult to say what should be prescribed without aggravating your condition. Please discuss with your doctor regarding a change of prescription and ruling out the above mentioned possibilities.Hope this helps. Please let me know if there is any thing else and do keep me posted. Take care!

question: Within last 6 weeks i have been experiencing sharp pain in all my joints (elbows, knees, shoulders, neck, back of my head, feet, balls of the feet, heal, toes, ankles, wrists, knuckles, finger bones, etc).  I also have sharp chest pain, 24 hours headache, sudden flashes of heat in my feet, numbling and tingling at the tip of my fingers and lower arm.  I had MRI done for only one joint (right knee) and my MRI revealed that i have a cartilage damage.  My GP ordered a blood test and Came out everything normal.  She ordered RA Factor, ANA (anti-nuclear antibodies) and both of them came out normal.  Just last friday she referred me to rheumatologists.  She told me due to the tender points in many areas I may have fibromyalgia.  But she told me to verify with rheumatologists.  I begged my GP to give me some kind of joint pain medications.  She gave me prescription for **Amittriptylene** for temporary until I see rheumatologists.  I started taking this medication just 5 days ago.  I have noticed that I have extreme craving for food and 2 hours after taking this tablet I crave for food and I end up eating nonstop.  I have extreme dry mouth as well.  I am really worried about putting on weight due to this medication.  I tried really hard for the last 4 months and I lost 10 lbs because my orthopedic surgeon told me to loose weight for my knee. He told me it will help me reduce the weight bearing knee since i already have most of my cartilage in my right knee and I am only 33 years old.  I have been loosing weight successfully by countring calories everyday.  But, this new amitriptylene tablets really scaring me off.  I am scared that it may make me put on weight due to its side effect of excessive craving for food.  Can I just discontinue this medication without letting my doctor know.  Is there any other medication i can ask my GP to prescribe me for the joint pain until I see a rheumatologists.  I need some kind of pain medications since I cant handle any physical activities due to extreme joint pain and stiffness in my finger bones.
title: Excess craving for food and Dry mouth!
